Messages.Message: This column reflects the Common Core State Standard(s) associated with a test item. Test items may be associated with more than one standard. For example, a question that asks students to evaluate research sources may assess both reading and research skills. For more information, see the English Language Arts Content Specifications.

Claim.name: Reading
Claim.Description: Read Analytically: Informational Text - Students can read closely and analytically to comprehend a range of increasingly complex literary and informational texts.

Claim.name: Reading
Claim.Description: Read Analytically: Literary Text - Students can read closely and analytically to comprehend a range of increasingly complex literary and informational texts.

Claim.name: Writing
Claim.Description: Write Effectively - Students can produce effective and well-grounded writing for a range of purposes and audiences.

Claim.name: Listening
Claim.Description: Speak and Listen purposefully - Students can employ effective speaking and listening skills for a range of purposes and audiences.

Claim.name: Listening
Claim.Description: Speak and Listen purposefully - Students can employ effective speaking and listening skills for a range of purposes and audiences.

Claim.name: Research and Inquiry
Claim.Description: Conduct Research - Students can engage in research/ inquiry to investigate topics and to analyze, integrate, and present information.
